name: snowshoe
content:
snowshoe noun [C]
(SHOE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
a flat frame with straps of material stretched across it that can be attached to a boot to allow a person to walk on snow without sinking in: Snowshoes may be necessary on some parts of the mountain. Distribute your weight by wearing skis or snowshoes. Related word
snowshoeing
Thomas Northcut/Photodisc/GettyImages

Winter sports
snowshoe noun [C]
(ANIMAL)
(also Snowshoe) a North American animal like a large rabbit, that can run very fast, and that has long ears and large back feet: Snowshoes eat softer grasses and also tend to run very little, making their meat more tender. Synonym
snowshoe hare
(also Snowshoe) a type of cat with blue eyes and short fur that has white fur on its feet and dark fur on its ears, on its tail, and on parts of its face: Cats developed in North America include the Maine Coon, the American shorthair, the Snowshoe, and the Sphynx. One of the photographs is of a glamorous cat that looks like a purebred snowshoe cat.
